'''Fréa''' ([[Third Age]] 2570 – 2659, aged 89 years) was the fourth of the Kings of [[Rohan]]. 

==History==
Fréa was the great-grandson of [[Eorl the Young]], and succeeded the long-lived [[Aldor]]. He was already seventy-five years old when he came to the throne. His fourteen-year reign is recorded as one of peace and prosperity.<ref name="Mark">{{App|Mark}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Fréa'' means "lord" or "master" in [[Old English]].<ref name="RC">{{HM|RC}}, p. 643</ref><ref>{{webcite|website=[http://www.bosworthtoller.com/ Bosworth-Toller Anglo-Saxon Dictionary]|articleurl=https://bosworthtoller.com/12198|articlename=FREÁ|accessed=24 July 2025}}</ref> The element ''Fréa'' appears also in the names [[Fréaláf]] and [[Fréawine]].<ref name="RC"/>

Fréan is also the name that [[Ælfwine|Eriol]] gave to the Valar in his Old English "translation" of the ''[[Quenta Silmarillion]]''.<ref>{{SM|QA1}}</ref>
